name: Park Hyatt Aviara Resort

reviews.text: I visited this property for a corporate function and spent the night.
reviews.title: Pleasant Holiday stay.

likes.liked: — Attractive detail and awesome coastal location.

reviews.title: Fantastic Vacation, Loved the Aviara!
reviews.text: I booked a standard room on the first floor (spa level). Room was well laid out, tastefully decorated, and well insulated against outside noise. Housekeeping did come offer turndown service. A bit surprised flatscreens were not standard in all rooms. Staff offered complementary hot chocolate in the lobby during the Christmas holiday. The game room offers a cosy respite with a mix of traditional and arcade games.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS: Understated California elegance without being gaudy. Efficient check-in and out, and prompt valet service. L'Occitane is the brand offered in the bathrooms.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: CONS: Few if any. Hard to judge meals offered as our dining was a banquet service.
reviews.title: Great service, great hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK, If I keep writing five star reviews, you aren't going to believe me anymore.... but this resort was truly fantastic! As others have mentioned, there are two sections of the resort where the "Villas" are located; I think most are timeshares. We bought a seven night stay (from ebay of all places)... and got a great deal! They don't assign rooms until check-in, and after reading about both villa locations - the summit and the meadows - I was still undecided about which was best. As it turned out, we got to try both. The first night we were given a room at the Summit location... closer to the main hotel. The room was great, 1300 sq. feet with a full kitchen, laundry room, and two bathrooms. The location wasn't terrific though... a first floor room overlooking (distantly) a fairly busy road. We asked the front desk if it were possible to move to a room on a higher floor. The staff were great and arranged for us to move the next day to a room at The Meadows. They assured us the view would be much better and they were right... the view was fantastic! We had two balconies, one off the living area and one off the bedroom - both overlooked the beautiful golf course and a lagoon... so nice to open the curtains and look out at the lovely view every morning.
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.text: Amazing all-around resort. Perfectly manicured grounds, wonderful staff, beach butler, free internet, met or surpassed each and every expectation.
reviews.title: Lives up to Four Seasons standards

reviews.text: This was my second stay at this Four Seasons resort. Unfortunately, both times were business trips so I did not get to take advantage of the spa and the surroundings. The rooms are large and the beds are the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on. The bathrooms are huge with a shower, large separate tub and a separate toilet area. 2 sinks and all of the extra lotions, etc. My most recent stay was on the 3rd floor facing the courtyard with a view of the lagoon. I took my mother with me on this trip and she sat around the pool and relaxed for a couple of days. They have 2 pools. The adult pool has a magnificant view of the pacific ocean. The pool also has private cabanas which my mom loved. They have a butler service that will take you to the beach, set you up with a chair, umbrella, food & coffee and then pick you up later. Very nice. Their bloody mary's are wonderful. The hotel is expensive....definitely over my normal budget, but it is a hotel you will not forget. Splurge!
reviews.title: Exceptional hotel & service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I love San Diego, used to live there and so we try to get back whenever we can. We normally stay in Del Mar but wanted to explore the North County a bit more. We are huge Four Season's Fans and wanted to try Aviari, and we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Delicious Thanksgiving at the Four Seasons

reviews.text: It was a typically wonderful Four Season's Experience. Arrival, Check-in and the Lobby Staff was efficient and friendly. They offered us an upgraded room for a discount which we did not take but it was appreciated. We had a standard suite which was sufficient for us. Bathroom was expansive with yummy soaps and shampoos, large plasma TV and a nice sitting room. Room and Bell Service was quite good with each person taking time to chat and provide some perspectives.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were to play golf on Thanksgiving day but when we awoke, alas it was raining (yes, it does rain in California) so the Pro Shop let us cancel. Food was excellent - we did a breakfast brunch and we did the Thanksgiving Buffet which was truly amazing, was great for families and couples all mingled together. We woke up the morning after Thanksgiving and they had already changed the decor to Christmas without missing a beat and we were ready for the holiday rush. We did visit the Residences Sales Office and took the tour, nice but not for us, they were helpful and not pushy, I think they are nearly sold out.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel
Beware of Credit Card Fraud at Four Seasons at Aviara
reviews.text: Beware of credit card fraud at FS aviara - actually not as serious as to be called fraud. But it may develop to a fraud if it goes further out of bound. For a reputable hotel, it should be strict in their use of customer's credit card.

It happened on Dec 31 2005 which is two days after I checked out. They secured $1,600 on 31st in addition to ~$2000 on 27th. So they secured ~$7000 including the amount I paid on 29th (~$3300). The $2000 should have been cancelled when I checked out having paid $3300, but FS didn't. I contacted FS aviara twice by e-mail (Jan 4 2006) but no response yet (Jan 6 2006). The ~$3600 is not, and will not be, paid, but my card is disabled temporarily because my credit limit of ~$10k was exceeded.
reviews.title: As Good as it Gets

reviews.text: It may happen to you in another form, and it is ok if it is a pure mistake and if FS tries to solve it fast once it happens. FS do not seem to.
reviews.title: Deeply Impressed With Four Seasons Aviara

reviews.text: I expected at aviara the same grade of food I experienced a year ago at FS Newport beach (now extinct). The Aviara FS needs a new food and beverage manager. In any circumstances, decent dishes shouldn't be salty as served both in vivace and in cal bistro of FS aviara. Not a good experience.
reviews.title: Fantastic week

reviews.text: The rooms are just fine, not gorgeous, but dark facing northwest.
reviews.title: Even better than my last visit

reviews.text: I stayed here in June of 2007 for a business conference. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are spectacularly decorated. The bathroom is huge and features both a bathtub and stand up shower, separate toilet area and double sinks.
reviews.title: Beautiful property; thin walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was extremely comfortable. The sleeping area featured a flat screen tv, desk, and pull out sofa. Because I was having a guest, I asked for a room with 2 queen beds, which, surprisingly, was not offered at the hotel. I was embarrassed that my guest had to sleep on a pull out sofa and wondered what the hotel was thinking in not furnishing rooms with 2 queens.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.text: My room had a great balcony that overlooked the main courtyard. We ordered room service one morning, had it set up on the patio and enjoyed a fabulously relaxing morning. The huge negative aspect of the room however, was the terribly thin walls. I could easily hear the drawers of my neighbor being opening and closed and even heard him use the restroom in the morning which is not exactly what I want to wake up to when staying at a 4-star resort. I was so annoyed that I wrote a complaint to the hotel which was promptly answered by a hand written apology letter. I thought that was a nice gesture.
reviews.title: Incredible

reviews.text: I didn't use the pool facilities but one thing I did notice and want to point out is that this resort is NOT near the ocean. It is clear across the freeway from the beach. I am always perplexed by resorts such as this and the St. Regis Monarch Beach that are located in beach communities, have ocean views, but aren't within walking distance to the beach. I
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, typical four seasons service

reviews.text: My husband and I went to this Four Seasons Resort for an anniversary in March of 2006.
reviews.title: Four Seasons Delivers

reviews.text: I had this hotel on my list for years back when it was the Four Seasons. The property is lovely- not on the beach but nice. We were upgraded upon our arrival and the front desk service was fabulous. We were hungry when we arrived so we ordered room service and it was over the top! The service at this hotel was top notch. It was everything we needed and expected. I would most definitely book this hotel again. The drive to the ocean is five minutes and there are lots of restaurants in the area. The pools are great and we enjoyed the bar as well. We also found a great jogging path that we enjoyed. This place is a YES!
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Stay in San Diego

reviews.text: Loved so many things! Hope I can return some day soon. Used points to pay for room-wonderful use of points! The scented lobby smelled fantastic and the hotel is so beautiful, clean and well maintained. Manuel from room service was great. The food from room service and at California Bistro was delicious-fabulous chef!!! The massage from Kimmy in the spa was the best-although spa services are too expensive. The concierge was so sweet. Printed out directions to the shopping center with an Apple store and had the valet put beach chairs, umbrella, towels and directions to the beach in our car. Front desk sent my daughter chocolates and bottled water to room for her 18th birthday! Fabulous visit and now we love San Diego! Looking for more Hyatts when traveling!
reviews.title: Love this resort!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Aviara for three nights and had a great time. The resort grounds are beautiful and well-maintained. Service is excellent - all of the staff were friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. The reception manager even walked us to the elevators after checking us in. We highly recommend the hotel for a nice get away.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location and Excellent Service

reviews.text: This property is nice but hasn't much character; clean but kind of antiseptic; nice location but no views; large but not many spaces to enjoy. Think large, wide hallways but no chairs. It's an odd property: all the guest rooms are on one side grouped around the pools, while the other half of the very large property is comprised of banquet/conference spaces. Only one venue for dinner (formal), and a very limited bar menu for informal dining. A nice gym open 24 hrs, but pool closes at 9pm. The landscaping is odd -- shrubs and trees are so high they block the view. Why are they blocking the view of the golf course and the valley? All in all, I just didn't get this property. I did appreciate how clean everything was, how large the guest rooms were, the pleasant fragrance pumped in to the hallways, the private patio, the quiet grounds. As others have commented, daily rates are considerably higher than rack rates due to mandatory resort fee and parking; why don't hoteliers just make these part of the basic rate? This is the only property -- from the highes to lowest end where I've stayed -- that hasn't provided an in-room coffee maker (room service coffee is $9-12 per pot plus tax, gratuity and service fee), and unlike other Hyatts, there is no lobby coffee service. One would have to travel to the other side of the property to get coffee from the restaurant (and not sure they'd make it "to go" back to the room). I'm not a coffee drinker but I know this would be very annoying to anyone who is used to a morning cup on awakening. On the other hand, this is also the only property I've been to recently that has offered a shower cap in the room (can't figure out why they stopped providing such an inexpensive but appreciated item). This won't be my destination of choice in the area, but I did appreciate my stay midweek at a very good rate.
reviews.title: not much character

reviews.text: Stayed for five nights this month. Altogether a pleasant experience, although one senses a slight notch down from what one imagines this property must have been under Four Seasons management. Door and valet staff were friendly and accomodating ($30 overnight valet charge); car was always brought up promptly. Lobby simple, elegant and dramatic. The pumped in odor was a bit much (like a nice tune played loud, what for?). Check in was prompt and courteous. Staff gave us general layout of the main floor and walked us to the elevators, which were a bit around the bend (this building has a very large footprint so get ready for long walks to hotel dining). Our room (panorama room) was simply appointed, clean and comfortable (comfortable sheets). Large closet, electronic vault of good size, oversized couch, functional desk and comfortable bed (a bit on the soft side). Flat screen TV was larger than necessary. Bathroom supersized and good amenities. Nice strong enclosed shower (separate from the tub). Towels were unimpressive. Maid and turn down service was good (towels replaced and ice bucket filled at turn down), although room was not first serviced until 4 pm two of our days (annoying). Very comfortable chairs on balcony overlooking lagoon and hills, with a bit of the hazy ocean in distant sight. Breakfast was included in my rate package, and the buffet was an invitation for gluttony. Quality stuff. Omelettes made to order. Very pleasant wait staff. I alternated taking breakfast inside and on the balcony, which had views of the golf course and housing subdivisions. Had dinner twice at Vivace, which had some interesting entrees and appetizers. I would rate Vivace very good, but not exceptional. Ate at California Bistro for one dinner, which was just fine. The atomosphere of the restaurants and the hotel's common areas is casual, with a mix of those in suits, business casual and shorts. Plenty of common area in which one can sit and relax. Nice bar off the main lobby. Wi-Fi "included" in the daily resort fee. Checked out but did not use the exercise room (looked clean and had a good variety of exercise equipment). We did not take advantage of any spa services, so cannot offer an opinion there. The family pool looked nice enough (certainly large), but we spent most of our time at the tranquility pool, which was quiet and pleasant. Very comfortable lounge chairs. Umbrellas if you wish shade. Water temperature just right. One can order a very nice lunch and drinks from 11 am until 3 or so (later for drinks). While the staff were attentive, the pool area was short on maintenance. Where someone dropped food (in an obvious place) or left a pile of ud towels on a lounge chair after leaving, it was far too long before these were cleaned up. At a hotel of this quality, staff should be all over this sort of thing pronto. We took advantage of the "beach butler." Very friendly and accommodating driver took us by van to Moonlight Beach in Encinitas, a few miles away, and picked us up three hours later. We were set up with chairs, umbrella, towlels and bottled water. Possible to order food to be brought along. The beach experience was pleasant, but not the luxury experience the hotel's pictures suggest. The beach itself was only fair, as construction was going on (not the hotel's fault of course, but wondered if there was a better beach nearby). Beach chairs that the hotel brought along seemed to come from someon's garage sale - they worked, but not appropriate for this sort of hotel. Easy to enter the water, and shallow enough for kids to play safely. Water's edge was good for a long stroll or jog along the cliffs off the main part of the beach. Pleasant mix of boarders, young families and older folks lounging. Back to the hotel: like other reviewers, I believe this hotel offers good value for a luxury resort and I would definitely return. The staff clearly aim to please. Park Hyatt run a good show, a notch below Four Seasons.
reviews.title: Solid Choice for R&R
Heaven on Earth
reviews.text: After driving for 6 hours from Vegas, it was so great to arrive at the door to be grereted by people opening your door and taking your luggage! We checked in straight away and were given a small tour around on our way to the room by Juan, he was so nice and uninstrusive.
Our room had great views of the Pacfic and was really quiet. Though if you had a room on the ground floor by the pools I can imagine it may be nosier.
reviews.title: Loved the service, room wasn't worth price

reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights and didn't have any desire to leave, to go to the Zoo was an effort.
reviews.title: Four Seasons excels at putting themselves in your shoes
Always Excellent, Always.
reviews.text: The lemonade left by reception is the best I have ever tasted!! Great to come in at anytime and have some. There's entertainment every night in the Lobby and it was always good. Great cocktails served at the bar and the staff are so pleasant!

reviews.title: Avoid Aviara not up to usual Four Season's standards.
reviews.text: Only wish it wasn't a continent away so we could go there every year!!

reviews.title: Simply......the BEST!
reviews.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVED IT!!!! Beautiful location, clean rooms which were beautifully decorated, amazing front desk team and wonderful valets and bellmen. Highly recommended. By the way....they have a "quiet pool" around the back where no children are allowed. This is my favorite Four Seasons property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife surprised me with a trip to FS Aviara late in February as a B-day present.
reviews.title: Great Getaway!

reviews.text: The resort makes for a nice getaway from LA.
reviews.title: Amazing...

reviews.text: We have been most recently to the FS Costa Rica (see my review), which we loved, and thus had high hopes for this property.
reviews.title: Unbelievable

reviews.text: Overall, the food was great, the room was tidy and comfortable, and the service was great. Not a fantastic as FS Costa Rica but good none the less.
reviews.title: Great for Kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this hotel! We stayed here for ten days to celebrate a birthday and the whole experience was great! The properties location is amazing. We originally had a room over the pool with a view of the marsh and a peekaboo view of the ocean and it was absolutely breathtaking. I was a bit worried about the noise being over the pool but it was quiet enough that we could leave our doors to our balcony open all day and not really hear a thing.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

likes.disliked: — some construction going on in parts of the building

reviews.text: We extended our stay so had to be moved to another room that was not over the pool but still in a great location that had amazing views. The whole property was gorgeous.
reviews.title: Impeccable Service, Nice Location

reviews.text: The hotel staff is wonderful and will bend over backwards to make you feel at home. My fiance' ordered flowers from their florist and the arrangement was one of the most beautiful I have ever seen and on my birthday they actually sent up another small arrangement of their own for me. They also made a special tirumisu for me on my birthday because my fiance' requested it and it was the best I have ever tasted. I also had a spa day while there and the spa is amazing. Everyone is fantastic and very professional.
reviews.title: Not up to Four Seasons standards!!!

reviews.text: I know am late posting this review but I was so impressed that I thought I should let other's know....better late than never!
reviews.title: Fantasic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a business conference and the place sits atop a hill over looking the Pacific, which is a couple miles away. The hotel is laid out very similarly to the Ritz Carlton at Amelia Island. I will say the service here was excellent all the way around. The golf course is fantastic. The Lagoon Trail is a great morning jog. Just a short drive to the ocean to go surfing, etc. The spa area and fitness center were pretty good. Overall, a neat place to visit. It's expensive out there no doubt, but thats So. Cal for you
reviews.title: Big, but very nice

likes.disliked: — If You dont play golf, You might feel a little out of place

reviews.text: Granted I was there as a spouse on a law firm retreat where many wonderful activities were offered me and the weather all weekend was a perfect ambient 70s, but this resort, located in scenic Carlsbad, a half hour from San Diego dished it up. From the nicely appointed and spacious rooms to the large high ceilinged common areas, to the excellent service and lovely events, i left this place feeling rested and refreshed and all well with my world.
reviews.title: A resort that stands out

reviews.text: This is the first time I've taken the time to write a review because I loved the place so much. From the second I checked in, the service was friendly, respectful, and accommodating. They immediately learned my name and called my by it every time. The room itself was clean, comfortable, and really didn't feel like a normal hotel room. Felt very inviting and warm. The workout facility is nice, get the spa package, because the locker room is amazing.
reviews.title: Best. Stay. Ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are traveling on business, as a couple, as a family...really doesn't matter, you will love this place. I can't suggest it enough.
reviews.title: Very disappointed - Could as well be in Legoland

reviews.text: We came to the Hyatt Aviara in Carlsbad for a nice romantic weekend. Unfortunately we were greeted by throngs of kids racing through the hallways and lobby areas and it went downhill from there. The hotel could as well be owned by nearby Legoland, it feels like an extension of it.
reviews.title: Great Place For A Conference

reviews.text: Let's start with the positive: Nice really big room with good view. Friendly valets. Nice grounds.
reviews.title: I didnt want to leave!!!

reviews.text: A friend and I stay at the Four Season April 19th -23rd. The hotel is about 30-45min (depending on the traffic), from San Diego Airport. Upon our arrival the doormen were very friendly and polite. They kindly took our luggage while directing us to registration. Once we were all check in we went to our room, and within a matter on minute or luggage arrive at the door. The room was spacious and the bathroom was excellent. The food in the hotel, was a little pricey, but satisfactory. Nothing extra special. They have a couple of resturants you can choose from. The property itself was very nice. While we were there we didnt experience any unruly children. We found most of them to be down in the game room.There housekeeping staff were on point everyday. Our room was often cleaned by noon and turn-down service was often done by 8p.m. The Concierge was very informative, and gave us directions to anywhere we were trying to go. Overall the service of the hotel was top quality, and I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay!!!!

reviews.text: Stayed in the hotel during a business meeting and thought it was fine. Had a great dinner when the pasta Chef cooked to order. Good service. Going back with spouse for a personal visit in May. Arrived by shuttle from airport last time, and taking a cab from Carlsbad Hertz to hotel this time. Looks like a short cab ride?
reviews.title: Four Season's Aviara meet's expectations

likes.liked: — the friendly attitudes of the help
likes.disliked: — Your kind of stuck away on a hill

reviews.text: Spendy $ 2400 a night but worth every cent. Staff is great with my kids. Location, food. Could not be better.
reviews.title: Could not be better

reviews.text: I thought the grounds, service and room quality were all excellent. I enjoyed seeing my kids run down the hallways of this fine hotel. I enjoyed eating with my kids in the dinning room with MANY other similar situated families. I enjoyed bringing my kids to the pool area and letting them frolic in the wading pool. I did not mind their noisy behavior because I could see beyond it - beyond myself.
reviews.title: My kids LOVED it!

reviews.text: We went to the zoo while we stayed there and it was enjoyable.
reviews.title: Caters to families/noisy kids but fabulous gorunds,decor and service

likes.liked: — large, well appointed suites, very fine service
likes.disliked: — noise from suite above, coffee service not replenished without asking

reviews.title: Tired, lacks character
reviews.text: Stayed on business for 2 days. The rooms were nice, but tired and a bit worn down. The main restaurant was closed on a Sunday night which was very odd for a hotel this size. For the price (including an over the top $30 resort fee) I would look elsewhere.

We had a conference here and the conference rooms were great. All conference meals exceeded my expectations. I think there are too few restaurant options. The food at the restaurants were very good. The Italian restaurant had excellent lobster risotto. There are two pools. One for families and one without children. There were definitely not enough wait staff at the pools. The spa was awesome. And my husband said the golf course was great. We had a suite and it was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Lovely place - great spa

reviews.text: We checked into the Hyatt Aviara for a little family R&R right after Labor Day. It was a stay-cation of sorts for us as we live in LA but we came home so rested that we felt like we'd been a million miles away. From the valet (Scott?!) to the front desk manager (Ryan White) to the concierge (Sarah G.), to the pool staff, friendly, incredibly helpful service and a warm small greeted us at every turn. We ate at the buffet breakfast each morning and it was delicious. We ordered food poolside each afternoon and we all enjoyed our lunch- if you've ordered pool service you know that's a nice surprise in itself. Our kids loved that the staff there had complimentary little treats- a toy for each of them upon check in, rice crispy treats sent up to the room upon arrival (we were celebrating our son't birthday) and another in the hot afternoons by the pool each day (smoothies once, frozen grapes, otter pops, etc). Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. It overlooked the pool. We also LOVED the beach valet service where they loaded us up with waters, towels and sand toys for the kids and then gave us a ride there! AWESOME! We were sorry to leave and on the drive home promised to ensure that this particular stay-cation becomes an annual occurrence in our family.
reviews.title: Fabulous property, incredible staff and delicious restaurants! YES PLEASE

reviews.text: Can't find words to express how much I truly love it here. We recently returned from our fourth stay in the past year. I've already written three previous reviews so this one will probably be my last; however, we plan to stay at this gorgeous gem many, many more times... just couldn't imagine my future without the Hyatt Aviara in it.
reviews.title: Have such an incredible, deep affinity for this place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wish I could pinpoint why I have such an intense affinity for this place. I jest, but yet sometimes I briefly wonder, if it might be evoking memories of a previous incarnation, where I once lived the most perfectly contented and happy life in a mansion which had a huge main parlour with an adjoining tea lounge, dining room, and a few smaller sitting rooms that looked very similar to the ones here. Regardless, I am so glad I found this place - it is very good for my soul, and I hope, upon my demise, that my spirit will make it back here frequently and and will sit and linger in all of my favorite areas over and over again.
reviews.title: Wonderful!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Four Seasons Aviara, is wonderful in every aspect, from the people to the facilities to the food. Upon arrival we were greeted by the valet/doorman who took our bags while we checked in. We arrived early and our room was not ready, so they checked us in and took down my cell phone number. We ate poolside while waiting for our room, and by the time we had finished our meal the front desk had called informing us our room is ready. The bellman showed us to our room, but unfortunately the lock was broken and no one could get in. The bellman immediately called the assistant manager who asked that we come back to the front desk. She offered to buy us some drinks and appetizers on their terrace lounge while we waited, an hour later they finally gave up on the lock and the moved us to another room, which was a wonderful upgrade. (As a side note, the next day upon returning from the pool there was a cheese plate and a handwritten note from the manager apologizing) Everyday at the pool the attendants were attentive and quick. They constantly refreshed your water and brought by sample drinks throughout the day. The pool servers were the only little hip cup, they were overwhelmed and sometimes service was spotty. We dined at Vivace one night and the food was delicious and the service prompt. The California Bistro had wonderful breakfasts and there was the only time I noticed children at the property. Other than that, if you stay down by the tranquility pool you will never see/hear them. The gym was well kept, TVs on every machine, and fresh water/towels. Overall it was an excellent stay and I plan to return.
reviews.title: Stunning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Aviara Four Seasons was a perfect example of the excellent hotel experience for which the Four Seasons chain is famous. The property is pristine and gorgeous, from the elegant lobby, to the beautiful pools and perfect spa. The service was so outstanding it was almost embarrassing. It was well worth the fairly hefty pricetag and I will undoubtedly stay there again. In fact, we have changed our next vacation plans to include a Four Seasons resort. The only negatives I can think of: every little thing was very high priced (no surprise), the rooms were a little plain for what I had expected (but very spacious and clean). Overall, a nearly flawless experience. Additionally, the Aviara golf course is breathtakingly lush and perfectly maintained with friendly and memorable staff.
reviews.title: Best hotel experience

likes.liked: — the pool, the spa, the staff
likes.disliked: — rooms were a little plain, not as finished-out as expected

reviews.text: We work and stayed at the Aviara and shot some elegant shots of our products.
reviews.title: Working comfort

likes.liked: — very clean, and staff was great

reviews.title: They Even Pampered The Children
reviews.text: Great location, staff and food.

reviews.title: More like a timeshare than the F.S. brand
reviews.text: Very accommodating in every way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything from entering the scented lobby when we arrived to prompt room service to hanging out at the pool created a perfect relaxing weekend retreat! My wife and I went for the weekend and were impressed by this property. The hotel is set up above the lagoon and a ways from the beach yet the higher floors of this property still have great views. We were upgraded to a panoramic king room as the hotel seemed fairly empty. Rooms have large balconies to enjoy the beautiful vistas. Only complaints was the bed was very soft (although my wife loved it) and that all the rooms around the pool can hear the kids playing/screaming. The adult pool overlooks the golf course and Lagoon and was amazing with plenty of chairs to relax in as you listen to the waterfall!
reviews.title: Relaxing Retreat!

reviews.text: If your looking for a great location for meetings in San Diego, CA. you cannot go wrong here. Excellent amenities, friendly staff, beautiful pools and the rooms are spotless. Golf course is beautiful and hillside views are wonderful from the pool area. However, be advised this is not a costal property and any shopping, walking out for breakfast or dinner or beach activity will require the use of a rental car, shuttle or cab.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel For Meetings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Elevators are lighting fast although only 5 floors they are really set up excellent.
reviews.title: Continued great service

reviews.text: We spent a recent long weekend getaway at the former Four Seasons, now Park Hyatt Aviara. We loved the service before, and it continues to be the same. The rooms are pricey but for the money and location, are worth it. Would love to see a lobby Starbucks type service for the guests, but other than that, we will return. Good job!
reviews.title: privacy plus

reviews.text: very comfortable rooms with exceptional bathrooms/showers and tubs/ great bath products provided. private pools to relax around with great service, nice area to walk in, golf with in walking distance, fabulous breakfast indoors and outdoor dining.
reviews.title: too many little things missing
beautiful hotel
reviews.text: this is a beautiful hotel. rooms are very nice and comfortable. great views. The pool area is very nice.

reviews.title: Wonderful Grounds, Dissapointing Service
reviews.text: Food in restaraunt (breakfast) was wonderful. The staff is very accomodating.

Hotel was beautiful and it was ideal for children. Our room was a bit dated - same TV that I had in my college dorm 12 years ago. Service was unbelievably bad for a Four Seasons. The Bistro food was excellent but the service was ridiculous. I actually bussed my own dishes during the breakfast buffet on 2 separate mornings. Upon our check-in, the staff was stand-offish; They made us feel "subordinate" since we booked a package through American Express. Also, they saw we checked in with 2 children and no one mentioned the huge playground and tennis center down the hill near the villas. We found out about the beautiful sports center from fellow guests on the second to last day of our stay. Overall, we felt the staff really did not want to be there.
reviews.title: Excellent service
Four Seasons' Luxury and Service At Its Best
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel, grounds, rooms. Impeccable service. Nice views from third floor and up. Great for business meetings, great restaurants. Only complaint, we were on the first floor near the pool and didn't have a view but couldn't change because the hotel was full.

reviews.title: Super in San Diego
reviews.text: Once again, the Four Seasons delivered. The accommodations, grounds and exceptional service were all top notch. This resort is located on a hilltop overlooking a beautiful golfcourse and a lagoon which has been restored to a wildlife habitat. The gounds are loaded with wonderful art and landscaping. The lobby and rooms are understated and elegant. Our room was on a corner with a balcony affording fabulous views. The area was not as remote as I expected from the literature. The resort is actually in a more urban setting in a residential neighborhood with several major thoroughfares within view from the room. There are plenty of places to visit in the immediate area, including La Jolla, San Diego, Del Mar, Oceanside, the desert, and more. The Quail Botanical Gardens in Carlsbad are a must for lovely trails filled with plants and trees. The only surpise we had was the enormous number of families with small children. This was actually undertandable with the proximity to Legoland and the Wild Animal Park and the fact it was a holiday, but I was still surprised and it may not have been the best choice to celebrate an anniversary. It was virtually impossible to enjoy a quiet drink in the bar when so many children were actually eating dinner in the bar. And the fine restaurant was a lot more family oriented and casual than anticipated. It was not the best venue for an anniversary dinner. Add to that that they seated us at a sofa at a table in the dead center of the room, and they knew this was an anniversary dinner. We thought that was an odd choice, but I am sure they would have moved us had we asked. There are plenty of highly rated restaurants in the vicinity, so dining off property is an option. Overall, this is an outstanding resort, and a lovely area to visit.

reviews.title: We are now truly spoiled
reviews.text: The Villas here are amazing for families, we have now unfortunately set a standard for our kids on places to stay! The CA Bistro completely catered to children with a waist-high food bar just for them, and a great beer/wine list for us! My husband said he knew he loved the place when we entered the amazing lobby and a soccer ball went flying, (oh-and the game room puts other hotels to shame!) Great Four Seasons, apparently Bono was there the weekend before, so there you go---Amazing place...

reviews.title: Wonderful Getaway, Columbus Day Weekend
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here over Columbus Day weekend. From the minute we arrived, we experienced outstanding service which is expected at the Four Seasons. For those of you have stayed at the FS in Maui, this property is similar in its style and landscape. While we checked in, we were offered a refreshing glass of lemonade, which was a welcome treat after our long plane ride from the east coast.

Guest Room: The hotel was no where near full, so we were able to get an upgrade. Our room seemed to have been recently redone. It was beautifully furnished and overlooked the main pool. The bathroom was designed similar to most Four Seasons hotels, which included a double sink, a deep soaking tub and separate shower. The L'Occitane bath products were very nice. The bed was very comfortable. The room was not as large as some of the other FS properties that we have stayed at, but it was still worth the price.
reviews.title: Great service - mediocre rooms

reviews.text: Quiet Pool: This is a beautiful pool overlooking a lagoon and mountains. The pool is an infinity pool with underwater music .. very cool!! The temperture of pool could have been a little warmer since it was only in the high 70s to low 80s while we were there.
reviews.title: ok- not up to par
Amazing service
reviews.text: Spa: The spa was one of the best I have been to. I opted for the Four Seasons Signature Treatment, which included a scrub, wrap, and massage. It was delightful and I would highly recommend it. The facilty was beautiful and well appointed with all the extras you would expect.

We stayed here in order to take our kids to legoland and the zoo- found it to be a wonderful place to come back to and recharge. The service was exemplary, especially for children. We came back to the room and each child had been given several little surprises which I won't ruin by revealing.
reviews.title: geat for kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It runs like clockwork, and every detail is thought out. Admittedly, we were there in the middle of the week. I don't know what it's like when it's crowded. We had the pool almost to ourselves, with people handing us fresh towels every five minutes and spritzing us with evian. I could get used to this!
reviews.title: Good objective review

reviews.text: The game room for kids is in the basement, but it's not all nintendo- there's a pool table and backgammon and I actually liked it myself. My kids would still be thee today if i hadn't dragged them out.
reviews.title: Disappointed at the Four Seasons

reviews.text: We stayed at the Four Seasons Aviara for a few days as conclusion of a two week trip in California. We were delighted to have chosen this hotel as it was exactly what we were looking for.
reviews.title: Older property, but still very nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is not by the beach but there is a beach butler who will take guests to the beach free of charge. We did not use this service as the pool was absolutely stunning.I am used to good hotels and good service and was really pleased with the service at this hotel. Staff are extremely friendly and will try to help with anything they can. I have read a few previous reviews saying it was a very busy hotel. While it is true that at the weekend the hotel was very busy with lots of kids it doesn't disturb as the hotel has 2 pools one of which is only for people aged 16 and over so while the kids pool is very busy with kids having fun, as they should the adult pool is very quiet and has absolutely stunning views which provide a very relaxing atmosphere.
reviews.title: Great getaway with luxury

reviews.text: My sister and I spent 3 nights at the Four Seasons. We booked a deluxe 1 bedroom suite. The room was huge- 800 square feet with 1 1/2 bathrooms. The room had 2 balconies with views over the pool and the hills. The room was pristine with a small fridge and beautiful master bathroom. It was very quiet and I did not hear anything or anyone at night. The hotel staff was wonderful and fiendly and went out of their way to make sure that we had everything we needed. We did not use the pool but there is a separate childrens and adult pool that looked great. This hotel is not oceanfront. There is daily transportation to the beach. We ate at VIvace restaurant in the hotel which was excellent. We had several spa treatments and although pricy it is the nicest spa I have ever been to. The only negative about the resort is the high room service price and $25 dollar price for breakfast but there are multiple restaurants within 5 minute drive. Will be staying here next time.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a week at the Residence Club on an Interval International exchange and loved the resort and especially the accommodations. Our unit was a 1BR, 2 BA with a very nice kitchen, large living room with fireplace, dining room with comfortable seating for 6 and a washer and dryer. The units have 2 balconies, one off the living area and the other off the bedroom.
reviews.title: Wonderful resort - we loved it!

reviews.text: My only suggestion is that you not leave anything in your car. Our rental car was broken into and my husband's golf clubs were stolen. Apparently there were a rash of this type of break-ins at the Residence Club. They may have improved the security by now but because of the location of the parking I still would not leave anything in the car.
reviews.title: Great resort - my whole family loved it!

reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay in spite of this unfortunate incident and would definitely go back any time.
reviews.title: Elegant Resort

reviews.text: Traveling for vacation with my husband and 2 elementary school aged children, the hotel was an outstanding choice. First, it's gorgeous with wide open patios, large garden areas and interesting sculpture throughout. The service was wonderful in all aspects. The pool servers were very helpful,setting up chairs, bringing around water and ice pops and serving drinks.
reviews.title: luxurious destination in Northern San Diego

description: On California’s sun-drenched Pacific coast, in the seaside community of Carlsbad, Park Hyatt Aviara Resort lies on the north shore of Batiquitos Lagoon – a vast protected wildlife sanctuary and an enclave of natural beauty. From atop the highest ridge, overlooking the ocean and the lagoon, the AAA Five Diamond San Diego resort provides a respite from the ordinary. Located amid 200 acres of verdant hillsides and rolling valleys, within the master-planned community of Aviara, our North San Diego luxury hotel and resort provides an appealing setting for any function. The resort’s Spanish colonial architecture welcomes with a sense of casual elegance. Each of the 329 spacious guest rooms – including 44 suites – features a private balcony or landscaped terrace offering magnificent views. Expansive facilities for meetings and special events are enhanced by complete resort amenities, from acclaimed dining to a full-service spa, swimming, tennis, a fitness center and an Arnold Palmer-designed 18-hole championship golf course.
